means: （电台或电视台的）听众可来电话的直播节目

sentence.Network_en: Just phone in your order three or more days prior to departure.
sentence.Network_cn: 在出发的三天之前打电话预订即可。

sentence.Network_en: She took part in a BBC radio phone-in programme.
sentence.Network_cn: 她参加了英国广播公司听众来电参与节目。

sentence.Network_en: Listeners have been invited to phone in to pick the winner.
sentence.Network_cn: 听众被邀请打进电话选择赢家。

invalid information found in the phone book ., 在电话本中存在不可用内容.
More common is keeping an electric dictionary in phone in case a need arises ., 更为普遍的是人们将一部电子字典储存进手机中以备不时之需.

it is not illegal to sell or pay for sex in England but many activities associated with prostitution-such as running a brothel , persistent kerb and advertising in phone boxes-are illegal .在英国，嫖娼和卖淫是合法的，但是有些行为却是非法的——比如开妓院、行慢车路边求欢（译注：翻译不知对不对)或者在电话亭里面做广告等等。
that way , manufacturers will find it economical to put chips not only in phones but also in television sets , sewing machines , robots and so on .如此看来，制造商会发现不仅在手机中而且在电视、缝纫机、机器人等机器中植入芯片是经济的。

the cameras in phones now offer multi-megapixel resolutions on par with many point-and-shoot cameras , but they continue to yield blurry , foggy shots , especially if you' re dealing with too little or too much light .现在内嵌于手机的摄像头提供各种像素或等同于袖珍照相机的像素数值，但他们拍出

entry.tran: （电台或电视台）听众（或观众）来电参与的节目
entry.def: A phone-in is a programme on radio or television in which people telephone with questions or opinions and their calls are broadcast.

example.ex: She took part in a BBC radio phone-in programme.
example.tran: 她参加了英国广播公司听众来电参与节目。

means.word_mean: 1. a program in which the audience participates by telephone
